original_result.ocr_text:
=== PAGE 1 ===
This Indenture
Made the 14th day of June in the year of our Lord, one thousand nine hundred and sixty-five (1965)

Between JOSEPH B. MCLAUGHLIN, also known as JOSEPH J. MCLAUGHLIN, widow, of Allegheny Township, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania, and MARY E. MCLAUGHLIN, also known as MARY MCLAUGHLIN, unmarried; and MICHAEL J. MCLAUGHLIN, his wife, of the City of Arnold, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania,

parties of the first part and

BUTLER DRIVE IN, INC., a corporation created by and existing under the laws of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, having its domicile in the City of New Kensington, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania,

party of the second part:

Witnesseth, that the said parties of the first part, in consideration of One and no/100 ($1.00) - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Dollar

to them now paid by the said party of the second part, do grant, bargain, sell and convey unto the said party of the second part, its successors and assigns,

ALL their undivided two-thirds (2/3) interest of, in and to all those two certain contiguous tracts of land situate in the Township of Allegheny, County of Westmoreland and Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, bounded and described as follows, to-wit:

TRACT NO. 1: BEGINNING at a point where the said tract corners with land now or formerly of John Stoops and land now or formerly of - - - Miller,; thence along the line of land of John Stoops North 11° East 211.20 feet to a point; thence North 60° East 183.15 feet to a post; thence North 7° East 429 feet to a post; thence along the line of land formerly of J. E. Norris's heirs and bounded by the following courses and distances: North 89° East 519.75 feet to a post; thence North 60° West 627 feet to a post; thence North 84° East 459.25 feet to a post; thence North 84° East 610.5 feet to a post; thence North 11° West 165.25 feet to a post; thence North 72° 30' East 879.85 feet to a post on the line of land now or formerly of William McLaughlin heirs; thence along the line of said William McLaughlin heirs South 16° 30' East 1584 feet to a post; thence South 16° West 264.30 feet to a post; thence South 7° West 1147.15 feet to a post on the line of land now or formerly of the Miller heirs; thence along the line of said Miller and land now or formerly of E. J. Miller South 85° West 1295.25 feet to a post; thence North 20° 30' West 1089 feet to a post; thence along the line now or formerly of the Miller farm North 81° 30' West 1320 feet to a post, the place of beginning. CONTAINING 121 Acres 100 perches.

TRACT NO. 2: BEING all of that certain tract of land situate in Allegheny Township, Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania, commencing at a post on the line running from the top of the hill above the McLaughlin house to and connecting with lands formerly of George Slonaker, now John Stoops; thence along the line of land described under Tract No. 1 by the following courses: South 9° East, 38 perches to a post; thence South 84½° East, 34.5 perches to a post; thence North 16° West, 35.6 perches to a post; thence East 15 perches to the place of beginning. Containing 3 acres and 57 perches.

=== PAGE 2 ===
VOL 1940 PAGE 769

BEING the same premises which Samuel McLaughlin acquired by deeds recorded in the Recorder's office of Westmoreland County in Deed Book Volume 60, page 338 and Deed Book Volume 86, page 310 (Tract No. 1) and Deed Book Volume 93, page 477 (Tract No. 2). Thereafter, Samuel McLaughlin died testate on September 26, 1899, seized of the premises, and by his Will recorded in the Register of Wills office in Will Book Volume 8, page 516, devised all that whereof he died seized to his wife and share alike. Thereafter, the said Samuel M. McLaughlin died testate on September 6, 1926, and by his Will recorded in the Register's office aforesaid in Will Book Volume 23, page 477, devised the premises unto his brother, the said Joseph E. McLaughlin. Thereafter, the said Joseph E. McLaughlin died intestate on April 28, 1939, leaving to survive him as his only heirs at law, Josephine McLaughlin, his widow, Dorothy Miller, his daughter, Holly McLaughlin, his son, and Josephine M. McLaughlin, his daughter. Thereafter, the said H. Josephine McLaughlin died testate on March 9, 1954, seized of a one-third interest in the premises, and by her Will recorded in the Register's office aforesaid in Will Book Volume 35, page 399, devised the aforesaid unto her three children, the aforesaid S. Holly McLaughlin, grantors Millie and Josephine M. McLaughlin, each sharing equally. Dorothy Miller, Administrator of the Estate of Dorothy Miller, deceased, conveying the one-third interest in the premises of Dorothy Miller unto the grantee herein, recorded the same date as this conveyance in the office of the Recorder of Deeds of Westmoreland County.

The actual consideration for this conveyance is $16,500.00.

Excepting and reserving, however, that tract of land containing 81 perches as conveyed by Samuel McLaughlin to his daughter, Mary Ann Miller, by deed dated February 14, 1898, as recorded in Deed Book Volume 275, page 450, together with that additional land as devised to the said Mary Ann Miller by the aforesaid will of Samuel McLaughlin dated February 19, 1898, as recorded in Will Book 11, page 121. Further excepting and reserving all restrictions, conveyances, easements and rights of way over and across the premises as may appear in prior instruments of record.

[Tax stamps and seal visible at bottom of page]
Allegheny Twp Transfer Tax
[Signature] James W. Kopf
Special Tax Collector
JUN 14 1955

=== PAGE 3 ===
VOL. 1910 PAGE 776

With the appurtenances: To have and to hold the same unto and for the use of the said party of the second part, its successors and assigns forever,

And the said Josephine B. McLaughlin, also known as Josephine B. Fitzgerald, a widow, and E. Kelly McLaughlin, also known as Kelly McLaughlin, and Gladys I. McLaughlin, his wife.

for themselves and their heirs, executors and administrators covenant with the said party of the second part, its successors and assigns against all lawful claimants the same and every part thereof to Warrant and Defend.

NOTICE—THIS DOCUMENT MAY NOT SELL, CONVEY, TRANSFER OR INSURE THE TITLE TO THE COAL AND RIGHT OF SUPPORT UNDERNEATH THE SURFACE LAND DESCRIBED OR REFERRED TO HEREIN, AND THE OWNER OR OWNERS OF SUCH COAL MAY HAVE THE COMPLETE LEGAL RIGHT TO REMOVE ALL OF THE COAL AND, IN THAT CONNECTION, DAMAGE MAY RESULT TO THE SURFACE OF THE LAND AND ANY HOUSE, BUILDING OR OTHER STRUCTURE ON OR IN SUCH LAND. [This notice is set forth in the manner provided in Section 1 of the Act of July 17, 1957, P.L. 984.]

Witness the hand and seal of the said part ies of the first part.

[Multiple signatures with seals]

Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
County of Westmoreland

On this the 17th day of June, A.D. 1965,

before me, the undersigned officer, personally appeared Josephine B. McLaughlin, also known as Josephine B. Fitzgerald, a widow, E. Kelly McLaughlin, also known as Kelly McLaughlin and Gladys I. McLaughlin, his wife

(or satisfactorily proven) to be the person s whose name s are subscribed to the within instrument and acknowledged that they executed the same for the purposes therein contained.

In Witness Whereof, I hereunto set my hand and official seal.
[Notary Public signature and seal]

My commission expires
1969

explanation.explanation: Our AI analysis indicates this deed does not contain mineral rights reservations. The property transfer appears to include all rights, including mineral rights.
explanation.recommendation: Based on this analysis, the mineral rights appear to transfer with the property. However, for complete certainty, consider having an attorney review the document.
